title: PySeascape library
text:
A pythonic remotable interface to RedHawkSC and TotemSC that allows integration with other PyAnsys and Python libraries.
PySeascape library

title: PySeascape library > How to install
text: How to install

title: PySeascape library > Install from PyPI
text:
User installation can be performed by running:
OR
Install from PyPI

title: PySeascape library > Install from latest GitHub source
text:
Fetch latest source from GitHub:
(Optional) Create and enable virtual environment. Please refer to official venv documentation for more help regarding virtual environment setup.
Install the project
Install additional requirements (if needed):
Install from latest GitHub source

title: PySeascape library > Usage
text:
Note: Either a local installation or remote connection to licensed RedHawk-SC is required to use the pyseascape library. This only offers a remotable frontend interface that can run directly in native Python on any machine.
Usage

title: PySeascape library > Launching local RedHawk-SC in backend
text:
OR
Launching local RedHawk-SC in backend

title: PySeascape library > Connecting to remote RedHawk-SC session
text:
All RedHawk-SC global functions can be called using prefix of RedHawkSC object name. Object methods can be called as normal.
Connecting to remote RedHawk-SC session

title: PySeascape library > Running RedHawk-SC commands
text:
For example:
Running RedHawk-SC commands

title: PySeascape library > Accessing RedHawk-SC help
text:
RedHawk-SC native help function supports command based as well as keyword based help.
This help can be accessed remotely as well.
Accessing RedHawk-SC help

title: PySeascape library > Known issues and limitations
text:
GUI features have not yet been implemented. Hence, commands like open_console_window, open_scheduler_window etc. do not work yet. Commands like gp.scatter_plot also does not work as it requires drawing GUI plots.
Known issues and limitations
open_console_window
open_scheduler_window
gp.scatter_plot

title: PySeascape library > Documentation
text:
Please refer to RedHawk-SC Documentation.
Documentation

title: Contribute
text:
Overall guidance on contributing to a PyAnsys repository appears in
Contribute
in the PyAnsys Developer’s Guide. Ensure that you are thoroughly familiar
with this guide, paying particular attention to Guidelines and Best Practices, before attempting
to contribute to PySeascape.
The following contribution information is specific to PySeascape.
Contribute

title: Contribute > Clone the repository
text:
To clone and install the latest version of PySeascape in
development mode, run:
Clone the repository

title: Contribute > Post issues
text:
Use the PySeascape Issues
page to submit questions, report bugs, and request new features.
To reach the support team, email pyansys.support@ansys.com.
Post issues

title: Contribute > View PySeascape documentation
text:
Documentation for the latest stable release of PySeascape is hosted at
PySeascape Documentation.
Documentation for the latest development version, which tracks the
main branch, is hosted at  Development PySeascape Documentation.
This version is automatically kept up to date via GitHub actions.
View PySeascape documentation
main

title: Contribute > Adhere to code style
text:
PySeascape is compliant with PyAnsys code style. It uses the tool
pre-commit to check the code style. You can install
and activate this tool with:
You can also install this as a pre-commit hook with:
This way, it’s not possible for you to push code that fails the style checks.
For example:
Adhere to code style

title: PySeascape library > Documentation

Please refer to RedHawk-SC Documentation.
Documentation

title: PySeascape library > Examples
text:
PySeascape can be used with local installation of RedHawk-SC or with a remote RedHawk-SC with running explorer_sc web service
PySeascape offers RedHawkSC (class) frontend client to connect to the RedHawk-SC (application) backend server
Examples

title: PySeascape library > Connecting to local RedHawk-SC application
text:
If a local RedHawk-SC application exists, RedHawkSC can launch and connect to the application provided the executable path is provided.
Example:
Connecting to local RedHawk-SC application

title: PySeascape library > Connecting to remote RedHawk-SC application
text:
In case of remote RedHawk-SC application, both RedHawk-SC application and explorer_sc server must be running. RedHawkSC can connect to the application using provided url to the explorer_sc server.
Example:
Connecting to remote RedHawk-SC application

title: PySeascape library > Using RedHawk-SC commands and scripts in pyseascape environment
section: Using RedHawk-SC commands and scripts in pyseascape environment
text:
All RedHawk-SC commands and scripts can be used in PySeascape-Python environment with minimal or no changes. All RedHawk-SC function calls must be prefixed with name of RedHawkSC object.
For example:
Using RedHawk-SC commands and scripts in pyseascape environment
